catalogue_raissonne: Hollstein 264, Le Blanc 118 (set); Wurzbach 71; New Hollstein 229
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: pony at L with monkey on its back, holding a branch that a dog is pulling on; another monkey on a bent tree trunk at R holding a club above dog's head; bee in ULQ, small shrubs on ground
inscription:
Signature, Inscription

numbered in plate at bottom center: 9
portfolio: From From Fighting Chimeras and Scenes to Aesop's Fables, Plate 9
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 11, 1986, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Horse with Two Monkeys and a Dog, From Scenes to Aesop's Fables
